column3: Developer of carbon fibre-based heat exchange and thermal management technology
column4: KULR Technology develops and provides carbon fiber-based heat exchange and thermal management technology solutions. Claims that the solutions provide better heat conductivity with significantly less contact pressure than traditional solutions including thermal gels, aluminum and copper-based heatsinks, and others. Provides thermal interface material which can be put between heatsinks and can increase thermal conductivity to 90W/mK. Has developed a thermal runaway shield that can isolate thermal runaway to a single cell and protect other cells. Other offerings include carbon-fiber heat exchanger, vapour chamber heat exchanger, and thermal insulation materials. Has applications in thermal management systems of lithium-ion batteries, consumer electronic devices, servers, electric cars, drones, satellites, and others.
column8: Energy Storage Tech > Battery > Battery Management System > Thermal Management > Carbon Fiber

column3: Underwater compressed air energy storage
column4: Underwater compressed air energy storage. It stores compressed air underwater and in a pressurized state and releases it to generate electricity as need be. Electricity runs an air compressor which converts the electrical energy into compressed air, which is pressurized to be stored at a certain depth inside accumulators. The air displaces the water in the accumulators and is held until electricity is needed by the consumer. To satisfy the need for electricity the system reverses the air flow allowing the weight of the water to force the air back to the surface under pressure, thus driving a generator, efficiently converting the energy in the air back into electricity for the consumer.

Potential applications include solar or wind-energy based microgrids in developing countries, energy storage for energy-producing residential housing and emergency generators for residential or industrial applications. column3: On-site energy storage for behind-the-meter use
column4: Atawey provides turnkey power supply systems for isolated sites, based on hydrogen technology that is adapted for tropical or temperate housing and for industrial uses. The company provides two forms of the solution, one for short term storage system with batteries, and another for long term storage system with a hydrogen chain. It has two different modes of operation, first during periods of high energy production when the system stores all the generated renewable energy in batteries. When these batteries are full, the excess energy is converted into hydrogen by electrolysis, then securely stored at low pressure and in large quantities for several months.  Secondly, during periods of low energy production when demand is high and the generation from a renewable resource is low, the energy is restored via a fuel cell.

column3: Thermal battery system for Commercial power consumers
column4: Thermal battery system for Commercial power consumers. The platform provides turnkey energy-management solutions that reduce operational costs and business risk for supermarkets and commercial buildings with high refrigeration-based energy loads. The primary product is a solution that uses existing refrigeration systems in a commercial building or supermarkets to store thermal energy during off-peak hours and deploys it during peak hours. As a result, electricity demand is claimed to be reduced by up to 40 per cent during peak hours. The Refrigeration Battery provides both load-shifting that offsets costly on-peak electricity charges and on-demand backup cooling when power fails. The solution is controlled through backend software which optimizes the Refrigeration Battery’s charge cycle by storing refrigeration when energy costs are lowest and providing cooling services at peak consumption periods.

column3: Concrete based solid state thermal energy storage
column4: EnergyNest has developed a concrete-based solid-state thermal energy storage (TES) unit which is used to store low to high-quality heat for multiple purposes. The thermal capacity can be used in various industries depending upon the requirement, for power generation. heat generation or to provide the only cold for food preservation. The core of the new storage system is the special concrete HEATCRETE, developed in cooperation with HeidelbergCement, which can store large quantities of thermal energy over long periods of time with virtually no performance degradation. In comparison to batteries and other forms of storage, the TES particularly stands out for its very broad application spectrum. The system can handle both thermal oil and steam as a heat transfer fluid and can operate within a very broad range of temperatures. The TES can provide solutions for various power and energy applications including Concentrated Solar Power (CSP), Waste Heat to Power (WHP), Power to Heat (P2H), and electric-thermal energy storage for wind energy and other variables renewables.

column3: Membership based solar power project developer
column4: Rensource has developed a membership and subscription-based solar power system. Once the user has shared their contact details, an engineer conducts a site study to determine the installation capacity and share the subscription details. Once the distributed power supply is installed, the user pays regular monthly membership charges, based on which a membership score is built that entitles the user to receive complimentary financial products and discounts. Additionally, since the system also houses a battery unit, the user can have access to unrestricted power even during blackouts or brownouts from the Utility service provider.

column3: Water & waste management solution provider
column4: Thermax Global provides water & waste management solutions including incinerators, chemicals, desalination systems. Offers water treatment systems which consist of; demineralization unit to remove dissolved solids, membrane system, an ultrafiltration unit, reverse osmosis(RO) unit for separation of solids & ion exchange units. Provides clarifiers for the treatment of surface water, activated carbon filters & water softening systems. Designs & installs effluent treatment which has a processing capacity of 50,000 m3/hr & consist of clarifiers, filters, aeration, coagulation and settling systems. Developed a domestic wastewater treatment system called as BioCask which uses unidirectional fluidization pattern for biological degradation of organic impurities. Offers digesters which process 5250 kg of solid waste per day to generate biogas equivalent to 1 Domestic LPG cylinder. Also provides containerized ultrafiltration and RO System for sewage treatment. Other products offered are pollution control systems, boilers, cooling systems & solar cells. Services offered are wastewater treatment, boiler audits & energy audits. Claims to have installed 20000+ products as of Mar'18.

column3: Develops a refrigeration system for use with intermittent power
column4: Sure Chill develops a refrigeration system that can function on intermittent power. The Sure Chill refrigeration system works by using a compartment surrounded by a cladding of water. Electric power is used to freeze the water. When power is not available, the ice melts and starts to rise. Due to water being heaviest at 4 degrees Celsius, the contents of the refrigeration compartment are always in contact with water at 4 degrees Celsius, or with ice, but never with warmer water. The system can be connected to renewable energy sources such as solar for off-grid applications, or the grid.

column3: Liquid-cooled system for servers
column4: Iceotope has developed liquid cooling systems suitable for traditionally high power and high-performance computing (HPC) workloads. Iceotope systems wrap each server blade in a metal case filled with dielectric coolant, helping avoid the costs and carbon emissions associated with the need to cool the entire data center. The heat from the blades is extracted through a secondary system that circulates water. Since there are no fans, they run quieter than air-cooled servers and can eliminate the need for computer room air conditioning units, humidity control systems or air purification equipment, lowering total consumption and energy use

column4: Smartcosa provides smart devices for boiler and air conditioning control. The smart devices are cosa smart room thermostat wireless combi control and radiator control. Wireless combi control consists of two devices. One is combi smart thermostat and the other is the combi control wireless unit. Combi control wireless unit directly connect into the boiler and directly to wireless internet. The thermostat is battery-equipped and placed where the home temperature can be accurately measured. This device communicates directly to the control unit through the wireless network. Cosa radiator consists of two devices, one is cosa radiator smart radiator valve and the other is cosa internet bridge. Cosa internet-bridge communicates with the valves wirelessly and allows the valves to connect to the internet. Up to 6 valves can be matched with cosa internet bridge and the user can control the temperature through the mobile application remotely.

column3: Energy efficient motors
column4: QM Power is commercializing a energy-efficient permanent magnet synchronous motor technology that significantly improves efficiency in domestic refrigerators and freezers, walk-in coolers and freezers, and commercial and residential HVAC systems. Their Q-Sync 6-12 watt motor is a synchronous motor, meaning the rotation of the motor’s shaft is synchronized with the frequency of the supplied current. Q-Sync cuts energy use by 30 percent compared to Electronically commutated motors (ECMs), and by up to 80 percent compared to shaded-pole motors. Currently, their technology is validated by the Department of Energy, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, and utility companies

column3: Energy resources distribution management solution provider

ElectrIQ system comprises three basic elements, an energy meter, lithium-ion battery storage, and an inverter. The device has the capability to understand device consumption parameters and suggest improvements and predictive maintenance alerts. The system comes with a cloud-hosted dashboard to monitor and actively manage power consuming units in the household. IQ system can be connected to either rooftop plants (solar/wind/other renewables) or to the grid for backup power support. The stored power can be used in-house or can also be sold back to the grid.

column3: Smart energy monitoring and analytics
column4: Zenatix is an energy monitoring and analytics company that helps large electricity consumers understand their energy consumption pattern and take steps to save energy. Installs energy monitoring equipment such as smart meters and controllers and sets up a cloud-based software for real-time monitoring of energy consumption. Stores the data from smart meters in the cloud and provides consumers with visualizations and analytics dissecting their power consumption patterns in real time at major loads, and take steps to optimize the usage by recommending energy-saving measures. Also developing Smart Grid Solutions for optimal demand side and supply side management. The company currently has 4 products under its umbrella, targeting retail, BFSI, commercial building, industry, and apartment. Founded by IIM Ahmedabad, IIT Delhi, and UCLA alumni. Claims to have more than 45 paying customers including Google, Starbucks, Xerox, etc. as of Dec 2015. Raised $211k funding from Google India MD Rajan Anandan, along with Snapdeal co-founders Kunal Bahl & Rohit Bansal and Trifecta Capital's Rahul Khanna in July 2015. Raised undisclosed amount of funding from Blume Ventures in Dec 2015. Raised $1.8M in a pre-series A round of funding led by pi Ventures in Feb 2017. Selected to be part of the Microsoft Accelerator batch in March 2017.

column3: Carbon dioxide capture from gases using amines
column4: CarbonOrO turns client's landfill or AD plants into a source of renewable energy and extracts CO2 out of flue gas. Their process captures CO2 from raw gas using a special amine solution, via an absorber and a desorber. Then the CarbonOrO amine solution splits in two fractions and all CO2 is fully released from it. CO2 concentrations for use of the CarbonOrO process may range from 5% to 50%. Application is in CO2 removal for CCUS and in upgrading of biogas / landfill gas.

Its chief target markets are F&B companies that use CO2 for aeration in food processing and greenhouse owners. column3: Converts CO2 directly into renewable fuels
column4: Joule Unlimited developed a photosynthetic technology to produce drop-in fuels in a single-step conversion process using waste carbon dioxide (CO2) feedstock, waste brackish water sunlight and a genetically modified bacterium. The company’s CO2-to-fuel production platform converts CO2 directly into renewable fuels, such as ethanol or hydrocarbons for diesel, jet fuel, and gasoline without the use of agricultural land, fresh water, or crops. Its products include Joule Sunflow-E, a solar-derived ethanol; and Joule Sunflow-D, a hydrocarbon diesel fuel produced directly from sunlight and waste CO2. The company has a strategic partnership with Audi. Joule Unlimited, Inc. was formerly known as Joule Biotechnologies, Inc. and changed its name to Joule Unlimited, Inc. in April 2010. It has production operations in Hobbs, New Mexico. The company sold its facility and laid off all its employees in August, 2017.

column3: Provides carbon capture solutions
column4: Carbon Collect's MechanicalTree is a breakthrough in carbon capture, and sets a new benchmark for capturing CO2 from ambient air. It is scalable (gigaton capable) and energy efficient - the two key limitations of other approaches to Direct Air Capture. The MechanicalTree can be deployed for capture of current and historical emissions for permanent removal via sequestration. Installed onsite, it can provide a source of green CO2 for a range of uses in food & beverages, industrial applications, construction and agriculture, replacing CO2 manufactured from fossil fuels, and eliminating transport and logistics.

column3: Manufacturer of low carbon cement
column4: Neustark removes CO2 from the atmosphere, it permanently stores it in recycled concrete and cuts new emissions by reducing the use of cement. The recycled and CO2-enriched concrete granulate treated with Neustark improves the climae balance of fresh concrete by about 10%. In addition to the permanent storage of CO2, this is due to the reduction of cement ratio in fresh concrete towards the regulatory minimum. More specifically: about 10kgs of CO2 are irreversably stored per m3 of concrete + up to 20kgs of new CO2 emissions are avoided in the production process = concrete with a 10% improved carbon footprint.

column3: Provider of carbon capture and sequestration solutions
column4: Blue Planet Systems developed a patented mineralization technology that is the only known scalable method for capturing and permanently sequestering billions of tonnes of CO2. Their process can use dilute CO2 from any source, at any concentration, and turn it into valuable building materials to enable carbon capture at a profit. Each tonne of their aggregate permanently mineralizes 440kgs of CO2, preventing it from ever leaking or accumulating in the atmosphere. If we replace 16% of all aggregate used today with Blue Planet Aggregate, we could achieve the Co2 storage needed by 2050 to keep temperature rise below 1.5C.

column3: Developer of a new chemistry to low-cost direct air capture (DAC) of carbon dioxide

Their technology recovers high-purity CO2 from the air while incurring only a fraction of the costs and energy it takes to do with current methods. They have developed a process that captures CO2 in its organic form, coupled with an ion-selective electrochemical separation process that continuously and efficiently scrubs CO2 from our air-contacting step and concentrates it as a pure gas.

column3: Advanced materials for carbon capture from gases
column4: Mosaic Materials is dedicated to reducing the cost and environmental impact of fossil fuels through the application of proprietary, highly efficient gas separation technologies. They utilize porous solids known as metal-organic frameworks to selectively remove impurities sucvh as CO2 from gas mixtures in an array of applications from submarines to power plants. They develop metal-organic frameworks, a class of porous solids suitable for gas separations owing to their large internal surface areas and chemical tunability.  The cooperative-binding technology allows the CO2-loaded materials to be regenerated using only moderate temperature or pressure changes, substantially increasing energy efficiency and decreasing costs.

column3: Provider of carbon capture and purification solutions
column4: Airovation Technologies is an innovative Air-Tech company that provides original, patented air purification and carbon capture solutions.the core technology can efficiently and economically capture and convert CO2 into valuable carbonate and bi-carbonate mineral end-products and oxygen. Additionally, this technology is capable of purifying indoor air spaces by oxidizing dangerous microbiological threats such as viruses and bacteria while converting harmful gases into oxygen-enriched clean air. The key technological breakthrough is the in-situ generation of superoxide radical, the strongest oxidizer in nature. column3: Provider of carbon capture solutions
column4: Compact Carbon Capture developed a technology using centrifugal forces to distribute the solvent employed for capturing CO2 - enabling more effective solvent distribution that enahnces mass trasnfer. Designing a carbon capture plant with CCC will reduce its footprint by up to 75% and require lower capital expanditures when compared to carbon capture plants designed using conventional technologies. Thanks to such size reduction, they can provide a modular and scalable carbon capture unit that can easily be deployed into existing brownfield sites and offshore.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Carbon Sequestration > Solvents

column3: Provider of direct air capture-based solutions for air purification
column4: RepAir provides direct air capture solutions, to capture CO2 from the air at Gigaton scale using a unique, ultra-low-cost solution. Their technology is inspired by battery and fuel cell principles, and their innovative electrochemical device utilizes electricity to separate CO2 from the air. RepAir enjoys the support of ESIL, a partnership of EDF Renewables, Johnson Matthey and Bazan Group. ESIL provides a platform for commercializing breakthrough sustainable solutions.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Diversified > Electrochemical
column22:
Counteract
 ESIL
 ImpactAssets
 Consensus Business Group

column3: Provides carbon capture and removal using electrochemistry
column4: Ebb Carbon provides carbon capture and removal using electrochemistry. They boost the ocean's natural chemical processes to safely store excess carbon dioxide from the air as bicarbonate, the ocean's most abundant form of natural carbon storage. Their approach uses the ocean's vast surface area to capture and store carbon dioxide, and their technology is built with modular, pre-fabricated elements that easily scale.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Diversified > Electrochemical
column10: Carbon Capture while reducing ocean acidity

column3: Provider of carbon sequestration solutions
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Carbon Sequestration > Adsorption

column3: Offering solutions to capture CO2 from the open air
column4: Carbominer offers solutions to mine resources from air, water, commercial, and industrial processes such as boiler exhaust and heater stacks post-combustion. They focus on DAC technologies. The captured CO2 is then stored or converted into a useful product, chemical or carbon neutral fuel.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Carbon Sequestration > Adsorption

column3: Provider of carbon capture & storage
column4: Vault 44.01 is a CCS project development team with experience in permanent storage of carbon dioxide. Their goal is to enable cost-effective, wholesale decarbonization of industrial emitters across North America through CCS. It provides a path to deep emissions reductions from large, stationary industrial emitters.

column3: Offering solutions to captures carbon dioxide from power plants and industrial facilities
column4: CO2 Capsol offers solutions to captures carbon dioxide from power plants and industrial facilities. They have three successful pilot projects, with more than 3,300 operating hours and >99% uptime. Their product CapsolGo is an environmentally friendly, portable, carbon capture demonstration unit with an all-inclusive package, including: transport, installation, deinstallation, oepration, deployment, and testing by an independent party. Stockholm Exergi has selected CO2 Capsol's End of Pipe solution as its carbon capture technology.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Diversified

column3: Provider of solutions to capture CO2
column4: Parallel Carbon develops a renewable and scalable DAC solution. It offers the world's lowest CAPEX DAC process to unlock gigaton scale deployment, unconstrained by grid decarbonization. They combine a nascent version of DAC based on passive, ambient mineral carbonation paired with an electrochemical process. By leveraging well-developed supply chains with low capital costs their process will rapidly scale, providing CO2 for durable storage and creating high-quality CDR credits. The technology is compatible with intermittent renewable power, avoids (or reduces) demand for fossil fuel extraction, and reduces the cost of achieving net-zero.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Diversified > Flue Gas Emissions

column3: Provider of solutions for direct carbon capture
column4:
NeoCarbon uses existing infrastructure in the form of cooling towers to perform DAC at up to 10x lower costs and time, which makes DAC mass-market ready.
Indeed, millions of existing cooling towers around Europe continuously circulate massive amounts of air to remove heat from industrial plants and buildings. By efficiently retrofitting those towers, we remove the carbon dioxide from all this air at very low additional cost. Several billion tons of CO₂ could be captured this way annually, a huge share of humanity’s long-term needs.
column8: Air Pollution Management Tech > Carbon Management > Carbon Capture > Diversified

column3: Provider of solutions to offset the carbon footprint
column4: Sylvera is a platform providing independent and in-deptch carbon ratings enabling clients to invest in high quality offsets and deliver on their net zero commitments. Their customers and partners include: BCG, Bain, Cargill, Salesforce, Shell, Equinor, Climate Impact X, World Economic Forum and Xpansiv.

column3: Provider of technology solutions for energy conservation and to resolve temperature imbalance
column4: Provider of a cloud platform along with wireless zone controllers to monitor temperature, tracking the energy requirements, among others. It fixes wide temperature imbalances in a typical commercial building. Claims that its module senses the temperature in each room and sends it wirelessly to a Central Control Unit that replaces a standard thermostat. The CCU aggregates the data and sends it to servers in the cloud to predict thermal loads across the building based on historical data and forecast weather. The optimum control strategy is then sent back to the CCU which turns on or off the HVAC equipment and instructs the room modules to modulate the dampers.

It also leverages individual motion sensors to work out which rooms are occupied. If one room is used, the temperature sensor of that room is used as the reference point for the entire home. column3: Building energy management system
column4: Stignergy offers a Smart Energy Management System (SEMS) to monitor and control energy consumption for increasing energy savings. SEMS modules called "Terminal" , learn and analyze for themselves the consumption of devices to which they are connected. These Terminals communicate with each other to exchange information on their state of charge and maximize energy demand. Gateway collects all data exchanged and allows sending them to a remote server via Ethernet, WiFi or GPRS which can be viewed in web browser. SEMS also used to manage the intake of local production of electrical energy from photovoltaic panels or mini wind turbines.

column3: Energy monitoring software using sensors on circuit breakers
column4: Ampotech is an energy monitoring and data analytics company that provides hardware and software enabling building owners to see where the energy is being used and to analyze that data. AmpoSense, is a patent-pending, circuit-level energy monitoring system where users simply stick an array of sensors above circuit breaker switches to measure the magnetic field and determine energy usage of each individual branch. It is connected to AmpoCloud, a real-time software solution controlled by a PC or mobile device which offers consumption of individual appliances, spaces, or machinery and electricity costs. Their solution is used by factories, offices, data centers, hotels etc.

column3: Plug & play smart metering system for utilities
column4: MiDo provides plug & play IoT-enabled flow metering system for the remote monitoring of water, gas & heat. The system consists of a submersible pressure sensor and sealed transducer; dataloggers which collects flow data from sensors, pressure level and communicates data through a GPRS module to cloud network; wireless pressure & analog data transmitter. The cloud network analyzes the collected data to detect a real-time loss in flow mass, billing on real-time consumption, optimize network pressure, and to calculate water & energy balance. Claims to have installed products for monitoring 5k-kilometers of the supply network and registered 20-million readings. Customers are GardaUno, Veritas, Integra Group, Piave Servizi, and Taglialegno.

column3: Provider of energy monitoring solutions
column4: Provider of energy monitoring solutions. The solutions provided include features such as providing real-time data analysis, with options to isolate the equipment which is causing a surge in energy usage. Additional features include identifying phantom energy and standby energy.

column3: Manufacturer of electronic systems and provider of industrial energy management solutions
column4: MB Control is a provider of electronic systems mainly used for industrial energy management and control systems. Solutions include plant monitoring, SCADA and energy management solutions, weather monitoring systems, and sub-metering systems.

column3: Microgrids operations platform
column4: Smart Nanogrid is a flagship solution from SunMoksha for management, maintenance and remote monitoring of mini, micro and nano-grids. Smart Nanogrid consists of an energy generation unit from hybrid renewable sources (such as solar, wind, biomass, biogas) with and/or without diesel generator and grid input, a smart local grid to distribute energy to consumers and a comprehensive remote management system. NanoSoft Remote is the software engine behind Smart Nanogrid for efficiently managing the operations which include management of power & water supply and consumer demand, intelligent scheduling to manage varying demand and supply for improved efficiency, metering, billing and payment with differential tariff for different consumer categories and time/amount of use, process, equipment & asset management and alerts and cut-off if unpaid or overused. They have deployed their Smart Village Nanogrid at Chhotkei, Odisha and Smart Campus Nanogrid at National Institute of Science & Technology (NIST) Berhampur, Odisha.

column3: Cloud-based platform for remote monitoring of distributed renewable energy resources

column3: Software product for energy asset and distributed energy resource analysis
column4: PowerRunner is a software product for energy asset and distributed energy resource analysis application. column3: Provider of distributed energy generation platform
column4: KRoad DG is a provider of a platform which assists in the management of distributed energy generation sources. The company develops, owns, and operates distributed energy generation sources. Uses energy storage technology in integration with the energy sources to effectively provide energy to a microgrid system. Solutions provided are in alliance with Green Charge Networks.

column3: Analytics for energy management and DER management platform
column4: Intelligent Energy Solutions (IES) is a suite of software platform including tools, rules, models, analytics and applications which operate continuously and automatically in the cloud. The platform gathers data from assets, weather, markets and other sources continuously and up to 5000 times per site per hour. This data is analyzed and acted on immediately, in real time, and recommendations or actions are sent immediately to effectuate the changes needed to optimize each situation. IES does not manufacture equipment, and procure data from gateway which in turn is connected to EMS/BAS, thermostats, load controllers and smart plugs of 3rd party providers. It also remotely monitor and manages the performance of on-site generation and storage to maximize returns and reduce consumer energy costs.

column3: Hardware and software system for DER control and monitoring
column4: Natus Energy has developed turnkey hardware and software solution for distributed energy resource controlling and monitoring. The system can be used to connect localized electric power generation sites with residential sites or commercial buildings. A cloud-based data dashboard is offered for remote monitoring and controlling of energy assets. The software can also be used for the management power consumption, optimizing power purchasing cost, peak electric demand reduction, and automatic resale of excess utility power. Can be used for projects generating 1k-45k watts of power.

column3: IoT-enabled energy management solution

column4: Provider of energy management software with integration of energy-efficient hardware for buildings. It offers Genesis - a platform that deploys and operates distributed energy resources to deliver savings, resiliency, control, and sustainability.

column3: DER management system
column4: Spirae specializes in the integration of large-scale renewable and distributed energy resources, the development of local and wide area controls, energy service platforms and power system simulations. Spirae Wave™ gives project developers, aggregators, IPPs and utilities the ability to operate microgrids with portfolios of renewable and distributed energy resources (DER). Wave™ Microgrid comes with standard capabilities such as Asset Monitoring and Control, Scheduling and Dispatch, Active and Reactive Power Import and Export Control, Islanding and Resynchronization, Frequency Control, Voltage Control, and Spinning Reserves Management.

column3: Virtual power plant networked software platform
column4: Virtual power plant networked software platform. It democratizes how power is produced, stored, and delivered to make renewable energy economically sustainable by combining battery storage with renewable energy sources. The software takes into account final energy consumption, weather, and historical patterns to assess the demand. Based on the demand it charges the batteries from renewable energy sources and uses them when there is a surge in demand.

column3: Provider of solutions for energy management

column3: Provider of renewable energy management solutions for commercial spaces
column4: Provider of renewable energy management solutions for commercial spaces. column3: Provider of underground thermal energy storage system
column4: Ecovat is developing a subterranean thermal energy storage system for the storage of heat energy. The system is based on a container-in-container principle and exists of a heat buffer, a modular integration of various wall sections and a system for the energy exchange. The heat and cold storage of the Ecovat is linked to a heat pump which operates on electricity that is supplied by the photovoltaic panels on the accompanying building or by the grid. The storage system functions as a big buffer tank where heat and cold can be stored and circulated deep below the ground. When required, the user can evacuate the heat and use it for a room or building heating.

column3: Latent Heat energy storage manufacturer
column4: LaTherm offers its customers a low CO2 heating (heating and hot water) at a stable, reliable and predictable price. They collect industrial waste heat, of steel mills, chemical or waste incinerators which is otherwise disposed of into the environment, in specially-equipped standard containers. Then this trapped energy is used to heat medium-sized properties, such as swimming pools, hospitals, schools, apartment buildings or commercial properties. The latent heat is transported there, and fed into the existing heating systems.

column3: Load disaggregation monitoring solution
column4: Load disaggregation monitoring solution. It offers energy monitoring solution by installing a plug-in sensor for current and voltage measurement from different circuits and sends the values to the database via WiFi Network. column3: Kinetic Energy storage for electricity generation
column4: Constructis has developed the R.E.S.S, Roadway Energy Sensory Systems. The system consists of power modules, where a strike or compression mechanism captures the kinetic motion of any heavy movements and converts it to kWh. Post this it can be metered and distributed to the grid or to power storage. When vehicles pass over the rumble strips on the R.E.S.S system, the modules, capture and convert the energy to electricity. These modules are installed and buried underground and have climate resistant structure, ensuring continued power production.

column3: Phase Change Material based Thermal Energy System
column4: RGEES specializes in design & manufacture of temperature control and thermal energy storage (TES) systems with Phase Change Material (PCM). savENRG Phase Change Material (PCM) develops products which are non-toxic, inorganic and organic products engineered for Thermal Energy Storage. Energy is stored as a combination of sensible and latent heat. During the process of phase change between solid-liquid, thermal energy is absorbed or released at a constant temperature which provides the unique capability to control temperature. Current range of products are mostly used as Cold Chain refrigerants in wide temperature range, Electronic enclosures heat sink, PCM-based Solar thermal energy storage solutions etc.

column3: Developer of solar augmented geothermal energy technology
column4: RenewGeo has developed a patented solar charged geothermal technology which can be used for the continuous production of electricity through geothermal power plants. Solar energy collected through solar heat collectors is stored in the nearby geothermal reservoir to increase the heat source for the power generation. Geothermal heat source is used during daytime and stored solar energy is used during nighttime for energy generation. This allows 24/7 generation of power at utility-scale. Doug Swift, inventor of this technology, along with UC-Won has established the company in 2017.

column3: Thermal energy storage provider
column4: HITES Energy Storage is a scalable thermal energy storage provider that works on pebble-bed technology. The product consists of of a 2MW Hot Air turbine, 5 MW heater and 50 MWh thermal storage. The surplus electricity is stored in the Pebble-Heater in the form of high temperature heat at 1100°C. When power is required, the stored heat is used to power a Hot Air Turbine coupled with a generator. Additionally with another set of low-temperature Pebble-Heaters the waste heat from the hot air turbine is recovered and the process efficiency is increased.

column3: Solar + battery + EV charging unit and intelligent hub system to sell excess solar energy generated
column4: Beegy offers solar + battery + EV charging stations to its customers. It offers top photovoltaic modules from the premium manufacturer and Tesla power wall home battery and Keba EV charging unit. It also offers monitoring and maintenance services for these products. beegyHUB turns the system into an intelligent power plant. The HUB takes over the networking between the photovoltaic system, the battery storage and the public network. It optimizes charging times, feed-in and consumption - so you consume as much of the self-produced electricity as possible, save the environment and save money. If the current of the photovoltaic system and the battery storage tank is not enough, the beegyHUB supplies residual current from the community.

column3: Provider of a network of nanogrids with interconnected renewable energy distribution
column4: Chainge is a provider of microgrid management solutions via nanogrid integration. The solution offered by the company involves the integration of blockchain technology and renewable energy generation with options for payments to be made using cryptocurrency. Uses a machine learning algorithm to balance the grid distribution of the integrated interconnected system of nanogrid photovoltaic systems. Energy generated in each of the nanogrids is distributed across the network based on demand as determined by the machine learning algorithm, and to allow for payment of the energy provided a system is created wherein cryptocurrency is used.

column3: Energy storage and microgrid solutions
column4: Energy Surety Partners (ESP) provide energy storage and microgrid solutions. Their FirmPower microgrid solutions provide low voltage and distributed energy resources for customers that need to shave peak power costs and more importantly manage ever-increasing demand charges with the help of FirmPower™ PPA. The provide both low voltage and high voltage battery storage, based on the first lithium ferrous phosphate (LFP) low voltage and high voltage batteries that are proven in the commercial and utility sectors. The real differentiation is a robust energy management software platform that is built on industry-leading algorithms that enable a wide array of energy services to C&I, Higher Education, , Gonvernment, Data Centers, Utility and IPP customers. Energy Spectrum Software platform automates not only the management and performance of the battery systems, but also provides asset and financial aggregation services to manage disparate energy storage assets across any geography.

column3: Distributed energy generation
column4: Standard Microgrid is a distributed energy services company providing distributed renewable generation and proprietary grid management hardware and software. Standard Microgrid’s first pilot is currently running on a rural test site in Mugurameno‚ Zambia. Their system draws energy from solar panels and takes an entire utility solution to rural users‚ typically in a small village. Instead of selling energy by kilowatt hours‚ Standard Microgrid uses a mathematical model to sell energy according to its use. There are different rates for lighting at night or to charge a phone during the day.

column3: Provider of thermal energy storage system
column4: EnergiVault provides thermal energy storage systems for industrial chillers. The storage solutions store electricity at low demand in the form of ice, and this can be utilized by industries and data centers for high-intensity cooling. Features include a cooling capacity of 790-17500kWh with 8500-190k kg of ice production per day. Claims to offer a service life of 25-years and can be integrated with the existing cooling system.
column8: Energy Storage Tech > Energy Storage System > Thermal > Ice
column100: Energy Tech

column3: Ice based thermal energy storage system
column4: Cryogel manufactures Ice Balls for thermal storage and process cooling applications. The products are 4 inch diameter plastic spheres filled with water. The balls are placed in storage tanks and frozen at night during off peak hours. During the following day or during peak hours, Ice Balls are melted to provide cooling and reduce peak demand for electricity. The positive environmental impacts of thermal storage have been verified in a report by the California Energy Commission.
column8: Energy Storage Tech > Energy Storage System > Thermal > Ice

column3: Solar panels for converting sunlight into red light for optimization of photosynthesis in plants
column4: Soliculture provides solar panels based on Lumo technology to convert sunlight into the red light for the optimization of photosynthesis of plants. Lumo panels has a low density of silicon photovoltaic (PV) strips arranged periodically on a panel of glass, allowing light to transmit between the strips. A thin layer of luminescent material(dye) is adhered to the backside of the glass, enhancing light quality by converting green light to red light. The panel is suitable for the cultivation area of greenhouses. It also supplies standard technology panels also which it claims traps 100% of sunlight and converts the same into electric energy using photovoltaic technology.

column3: Offering asset intelligence and forecasting for electricity, water and gas segments
column4: DCbrain turns the Internet of Things into the Internet of Streams, applying data mining and artificial intelligence to physical electricity, water, gas and cooling-system networks not only to detect anomalies and anticipate incidents but also to predict their future requirements. Their software uses vast amounts of data to process and visualizes physical flows in industrial networks in real-time, turning the physical network into a digital network that provides a “bird’s-eye view” of what is happening in power grids, water networks and gas pipelines. This enables operators to reduce maintenance and operational costs and optimize the management of their network.

column3: New Zealand’s peer to peer energy provider using solar power
column4: P2 Power developed the technology, named SolarShare, to enable those who don’t have solar panels to buy solar power directly from those who contribute excess amounts to the grid. SolarShare works by sourcing local solar-power generators, such as neighboring households or businesses. When spare power is exported into the network, their meter records it and P2 Power matches it to another customer who is using power at the same time. When there’s not enough local power to meet the customer’s needs, the rest is supplied via traditional power stations. During summer when solar generation is high they guarantee at least 7% of consumers power use will be charged at the P2P rate.

Also provides software for energy suppliers which can be used for online billing, rewards allocation, renewable source integration, and customer segregation activities.

column3: Provider of electric utility and power grid management solutions
column4: ResilientGrid specializes in providing electric utility and power grid solutions. It offers software called ResilientGrid OS for electric utility control room that allows users to monitor the entire grid system on the platform. The features of the software include ResilientGrid Map that provides the grid network on the video wall, ResilientGrid Network Model Validator, ResilientGrid Alarm Management, ResilientGrid Incident Manager, and ResilientGrid Communicator.

column3: Offering active cooling solutions for industries
column4: Scolcod provides active cooling solutions using sunlight for multiple industries including military, space, airlines, automotive, construction, marine, and others. It uses anti-stokes fluorescence patent pending technology.

column3: Provider of a cooling film based on hybrid glass microsphere-plastic metamaterials
column4: Radi-Cool offers cooling film based on hybrid glass microsphere-plastic metamaterials which act as a kind of air conditioning system for structures. It has the ability to cool an object underneath the radiative cooling film. The material further can be developed as green building envelope materials including roof shingles, sidings, and windows.

column3: Fridge with an integrated battery for power outages
column4: Coolfinity has developed a cooling technology for fridges with intermittent power availability in developing countries. It has developed a 600L fridge integrated with thermal battery to withstand power outages of 12 to 20 hours per day. When the power is off the ice bank technology freezes 50 kg water that functions as a cold battery to maintain temperatures of 3 to 6 degrees Celsius and releases cold air gradually and when power is restored, the ice bank immediately recharges. Useful to keep food, beverages and medicines cold at a stable 3 degrees Celsius. Plans to supply their technology to fridge manufacturers.

column3: Commercializes Carbon Engineering’s DAC tech at an industrial-scale.
column4: Commercializes Carbon Engineering’s DAC tech at an industrial-scale. By commercializing numerous decarbonization solutions, 1PointFive expects to provide practical options for organizations to reduce their carbon impact. Currently, 1PointFive is developing solutions that include Direct Air Capture (DAC), point-source capture, geologic sequestration hubs and AIR TO FUELS™ facilities.
